title: Sequential imaging of Zika-exposed fetuses reveals most have normal brain development

title_detail.value: Sequential imaging of Zika-exposed fetuses reveals most have normal brain development

summary: Ultrasound (US) imaging performed during pregnancy and after childbirth revealed most Zika-related brain abnormalities experienced by infants exposed to the Zika virus during pregnancy. Some Zika-exposed infants whose imaging had been normal during pregnancy had mild brain abnormalities detected by US and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) after they were born.
